arts.sum: Wolves were better throughout the second half, but had to play the majority of it with 10 men after captain Toti Gomes was given a straight red card. A dangerous Brooks cross then set up Semenyo from five yards at the far post and when it was harder to miss, the forward somehow knocked the ball onto the crossbar and failed to double Bournemouth's lead.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth's win against 10-man Wolves was uncomfortable - Iraola
arts.sum: Bournemouth manager Adoni Iraola says his side's victory against Wolverhampton Wanderers was "uncomfortable" after The Cherries missed chances to seal the game after the visitors went down to 10 men.

arts.ttl: Marcus Tavernier’s goal gets Bournemouth up and running with win over Wolves
arts.sum: The goal owed a little to good fortune.

arts.ttl: Gary Lineker explains why he thinks Wolves will lose to Bournemouth
arts.sum: Gary Lineker explains why he thinks Bournemouth will win against Wolves Lineker was critical of Vitor Pereira’s tactical approach in the season opener against Man City, and he, like us, will be hoping to see a more attacking lineup for this Bournemouth game .

arts.ttl: A clear sign that Wolves have an incredible chance of getting a result vs Bournemouth
arts.sum: Wolves have the chance to pick up their first points of the Premier League season when they take on Bournemouth this weekend and a streak that they are on points to this being a great opportunity. Wolves have never lost away to Bournemouth in the Premier League

arts.ttl: Wolves XI vs Bournemouth – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Wolves travel to the south coast to face AFC Bournemouth on Saturday under early-season pressure. A demoralising 4-0 defeat to Manchester City on the opening day extended the club’s winless league run to five games. Manager Vitor Pereira will be demanding a huge response from his players in what is already a vital match. arts.ttl: Bournemouth vs Wolves – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: AFC Bournemouth and Wolverhampton Wanderers are both eager to secure their first points of the season when they meet at the Vitality Stadium on Saturday. Bournemouth enter the match in 16th place, while Wolves are languishing in 20th after heavy opening-day defeats. Despite an opening-day defeat, Andoni Iraola’s side will be full of confidence after a courageous performance against champions Liverpool. arts.ttl: Andoni Iraola is upbeat about Wolves’ prospects despite defeat on opening matchday
arts.sum: I think they have good, physical defenders, even the games we played against them here: we had one of the red card, and the other one, it was difficult to score against them.” It’s normal: first game of the season the four defenders first time they play together so things we need to improve like I suppose every team now in in this moment but overall it was a very good game from our side.”
